intro: Draba leiopoda, commonly known as the smoothleaf whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as alpine meadows and open woodlands. Draba leiopoda has basal leaves that are smooth and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It blooms in early spring, producing bright yellow flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
